wikipedia_page.main: Foster Moverley McRae, commonly known as Peter McRae (12 February 1916 – 25 February 1944) was an English cricketer who played 25 first-class matches for Somerset County Cricket Club between 1936 and 1939.  He died during the Second World War, when HMS Mahratta, which he served on as Surgeon Lieutenant, was torpedoed and sunk in the Barents Sea.
